stadium.name: The Sinking Field
stadium.description: A notoriously poorly-maintained stadium built on reclaimed marshland. The ground is unstable, often waterlogged, and sections of the stands are known to collapse.

stats.pregame_ritual: Seeing who on the team can belch the loudest.
Meditating silently in the corner of the locker room.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Insisting on being the last player to leave the locker room.
Daring a teammate to eat a live worm.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Tapping each piece of their armor in a specific sequence.
Insisting on being the last player to leave the locker room.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.

stadium.name: The Glowstone Terrace
stadium.description: A massive, opulent stadium built on one of the city's main terraces, carved directly into the mountainside. The field is famously paved with polished Glowstone, and the stands overlook the bustling Confluence Market and the ongoing construction of the Guild's Skyport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Doing a terrible, clumsy dance to 'loosen the joints'.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Covering their forearms in a sticky tree sap for 'grip'.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).

preGame:
### üéôÔ∏è STEP RIGHT UP, SPORTS FANS! IT'S PLAYOFF TIME IN OSTERRA! üèüÔ∏è

Hello, you beautiful souls, you seekers of carnage, you lovers of the grand old game! This is Nok the Corrupter coming to you live from the most wonderfully dilapidated patch of swamp in the realm‚Äî**The Sinking Field**! We are kicking off the post-season with a Best of 3 clash that‚Äôll make your teeth rattle! The air is thick with noxious fumes, the mud is up to our knees, and the playoff atmosphere is absolutely electric‚Äîor maybe that‚Äôs just the swamp gas igniting! 

Our home team today, the pride of the pits, the **Ebon Gate Corruptors**, are looking to defend their turf! I tell ya, folks, I saw Amedeo Bari in the tunnel polishing his boots with pure bacon grease‚Äînow that‚Äôs a man who knows how to slide through a tackle! Olnek Vizzone is over there clapping his hands in prime numbers, looking focused, looking sharp, looking ready to break some ribs for the glory of the Gate! They‚Äôve got the grit, they‚Äôve got the smell, and they‚Äôve got my heart!

But don't count out the visitors! Traveling down from the mountain peaks, we have **The Confluence Captains**! They‚Äôre looking a bit high-and-mighty for a bunch of Guild-backed glory-seekers. I caught Ladew Evelina chugging a raw egg‚Äîshell and all!‚Äîwhile O'Conner Maighdlin is refusing to speak unless it rhymes! Can you believe the gall of these mountain-dwellers? They might have the fancy scimitars and the Guild‚Äôs gold, but can they survive the sinkholes of Ebon Gate? 

It's a beautiful day for Trollball, folks! The stands are sagging, the mud is churning, and the Everwar ensures that even if a player loses a head, they‚Äôll be back for Game 2! Let‚Äôs get ready for some sanctioned slaughter! üèêüí•
postGame:
### üéôÔ∏è THE FINAL WHISTLE BLOWS ON A SWAMP-SOAKED SHAMBLES! üèüÔ∏è

Great shades of Orzalon, what a display of athletic brutality we‚Äôve witnessed here today! While my beloved **Ebon Gate Corruptors** didn't quite find the basket, the medical tents are absolutely overflowing, and isn't that the real victory? The Confluence Captains take Game 1 of this series with a staggering 6-0 victory, but they‚Äôll be picking mud and teeth out of their gear for a month! Let‚Äôs break down this wonderful mess!

Things started fast and filthy in Center Field! Simsar Carrelli scooped up the head early, but the Captains‚Äô O'Conner Maighdlin decided he wasn‚Äôt there to play ball‚Äîhe was there to play butcher! With a hatchet in hand, he sent Amedeo Bari and Napoleon Anzovin to the infirmary before the game even had its legs! I haven‚Äôt seen such efficient work since Cyfnerth the Butcher last went grocery shopping!

The Captains didn't just fight; they moved the leather. Carnahan Laud, that dandelion-eating dynamo, took a shot from the Away Field and zipped it right through the goal for 2 points! My Corruptors tried to respond, but the mud was a cruel mistress today. Smith Syst and Bullion Iglesias were trading passes like they were at a fancy tea party held by Maple the Tree, but they couldn't find the end zone!

Before we could even catch our breath, O'Conner Maighdlin‚Äîstill rhyming, I assume‚Äîthrew a long-range beauty from Center Field! **BOOM!** Two more points for the mountain-dwellers! The Corruptors looked stuck in the muck, and Behl Berstine made them pay, charging into the end zone for a 1-point dunk that felt like a dagger to the soul. It was 5-0 before the halftime fumes even started to make the fans hallucinate!

Speaking of halftime, our players came back looking a bit woozy! Between the noxious fumes of the Sinking Field and whatever questionable spirits they‚Äôre swilling in the locker room, the second half was a masterclass in drunken violence! Smith Syst got absolutely leveled by Richia Pazit, and the sound of that impact was sweeter than any siren's song! 

But my boys wouldn't go down without a fight! Napoleon Anzovin got his revenge, putting Vonni Geoff into the dirt, and Ellette Paz absolutely flattened Stephan Lisk! It was a regular meat-grinder out there! Even the Guild of the Black Sky‚Äôs own Brennen Farno would‚Äôve blushed at the amount of blood being spent‚Äîand we know how he feels about spending anything!

The injuries just kept piling up! Richia Pazit, Behl Berstine, and Deach Sharlene all found themselves on the wrong end of a weapon. It was a beautiful, chaotic symphony of groans and clashing steel! If only Sir Tanos could see this‚Äîhe‚Äôd probably try to stab me for enjoying it so much, the big lug!

Despite the Corruptors' best efforts to turn the game into a wrestling match, the Captains found one more opening. Belding Chloe, who I suspect spent the morning rubbing her armor in armpit sweat for 'luck,' powered through the defense and dunked the final point of the match! 6-0, a clean sweep on the scoreboard, even if the players are anything but clean!

I must say, I‚Äôm disappointed in the result, but thrilled by the carnage! My Corruptors showed heart, mostly by leaving bits of it on the field. Those Captains think they‚Äôre so smart with their 'literacy' and their 'scimitars,' but they‚Äôre going to need more than a rhyme to survive Game 2! 

The series stands at 1-0 in favor of the **Confluence Captains**. If the Corruptors don't find their footing in the mud soon, they‚Äôll be heading to the loser‚Äôs bracket faster than a fey circus flees a Linaius rant! 

Final Score: **The Confluence Captains 6, The Ebon Gate Corruptors 0**. 

Stay tuned for more Tuesday Night Trollball! May your drinks be strong and your armor be reinforced! Nok the Corrupter, signing off! üèêüíÄüçª
